definition[0]: the hard outer part that covers and protects an egg, nut, or seed
example[0]: Never buy eggs with cracked shells.
definition[1]: the hard protective covering of an animal such as a snail, mussel, or crab
example[3]: The children were collecting shells on the beach.
definition[2]: a metal container, like a large bullet, which is full of an explosive substance and is fired from a large gun
example[4]: We ran for cover as shells dropped all around us.
definition[3]: a metal tube containing a bullet and an explosive substance
definition[4]: the outside structure of something, especially the part of a building that remains when the rest of it has been destroyed
example[6]: the burnt-out shell of a nightclub
definition[5]: to fire shells from large guns at something
example[7]: The army has been shelling the town since yesterday.
definition[6]: to remove something such as beans or nuts from a shell or pod
example[8]: Josie was shelling peas in the kitchen.
definition[7]: a very large international oil company which has many petrol stations world-wide
